Name: Head from a statuette of Horus as a child
Description: Eroded head from a terracotta figurine of the god Horus, depicted as a child in the style of Hellenistic Greek art, with Pharaonic Egyptian attributes to identify the god (finger to the mouth, gesture of childhood in Pharaonic art, and reduced version of the Double Crown). The figure belongs to the extensive category of Hellenistic terracottas produced throughout the Eastern Mediterranean.
